title: Define sync manifest for structural files
description: Create a manifest file that categorizes files into: (1) sync - files that should match the template exactly, (2) customize - files projects should modify (e.g., CLAUDE.md project-specific sections), (3) ignore - files not tracked for sync purposes. This manifest enables the health-check command to know what to compare.
completion_notes: Created sync-manifest.json at three levels: root, lite, and standard. Three categories defined: (1) sync - commands/*.md, reference docs (must match template), (2) customize - CLAUDE.md, README.md, context files (user modifies), (3) ignore - tasks/*.json, task-overview.md, version.json, sync-manifest.json (local state). Uses glob patterns for flexible file matching.
notes: Categories to define: sync (commands, reference docs), customize (CLAUDE.md, overview.md), ignore (tasks/, local state). Consider glob patterns for flexibility. Note: Root .claude/sync-manifest.json is the master definition. Template manifests (lite/, standard/) are copies included when users bootstrap - they reference back to this repo for comparisons.

assumptions.validation_method: Review all file types in templates

assumptions.description: Glob patterns provide enough flexibility for file matching

decision_rationale: Three categories provide clear guidance: sync ensures structural integrity, customize allows project-specific content, ignore prevents local state from being tracked. Glob patterns enable flexible file matching without enumerating every file.
